{
    "number": 287310,
    "data": "19,37,521,911,1171,1301,1951,2081,2341,2731,2861,3121,3251,3511,32833,35911,37963,43093,44119,46171,53353,56431,57457,59509,61561,68743,71821,77977,85159,87211,88237,90289,95419,99523,100549,114913,117991,123121,124147,126199",
    "name": "Primes that can be generated by the concatenation in base 8, in ascending order, of two consecutive integers read in base 10.",
    "comment": [
        "Primes of the form (1+8^k) m + 1 where m+1 < 8^k < 8(m+1). - _Robert Israel_, May 24 2017"
    ],
    "link": [
        "Robert Israel, <a href=\"/A287310/b287310.txt\">Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000</a>"
    ],
    "example": [
        "2 and 3 in base 8 are 2 and 3 and concat(2,3) = 23 in base 10 is 19;",
        "8 and 9 in base 8 are 10 1nd 11 and concat(10,11) = 1011 in base 10 is 521"
    ],
    "maple": [
        "with(numtheory): P:= proc(q,h) local a,b,c,d,k,n; a:=convert(q+1,base,h); b:=convert(q,base,h); c:=[op(a),op(b)]; d:=0; for k from nops(c) by -1 to 1 do d:=h*d+c[k]; od; if isprime(d) then d; fi; end: seq(P(i,8),i=1..1000);"
    ],
    "mathematica": [
        "With[{b = 8}, Select[Map[FromDigits[Flatten@ IntegerDigits[#, b], b] &, Partition[Range@ 250, 2, 1]], PrimeQ]] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, May 25 2017 *)"
    ],
    "xref": [
        "Cf. A000040, A030458."
    ],
    "keyword": "nonn,base,easy",
    "offset": "1,1",
    "author": "_Paolo P. Lava_, May 24 2017",
    "references": 1,
    "revision": 17,
    "time": "2017-05-26T03:19:49-04:00",
    "created": "2017-05-24T10:44:02-04:00"
}
